Contact Management REST API Documentation¶

Welcome to the Contact Management API documentation. This API provides a complete solution for managing contacts with user authentication, email verification, and avatar management.

Core Features¶

  • User authentication and authorization

  • Contact management (CRUD operations)

  • Birthday notifications

  • Email verification

  • Avatar management

  • Rate limiting protection

API Endpoints¶

Authentication¶

Contacts¶

Users¶

Utilities¶

Data Models¶

Database Models¶

class Base(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: DeclarativeBase

Base class for all database models.

This class provides common functionality and metadata for all models.

Parameters:

kwargs (Any)

metadata: ClassVar[MetaData] = MetaData()¶

Refers to the _schema.MetaData collection that will be used for new _schema.Table objects.

See also

orm_declarative_metadata

registry: ClassVar[_RegistryType] = <sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.registry object>¶

Refers to the _orm.registry in use where new _orm.Mapper objects will be associated.

class Contact(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Base

Model representing a contact in the address book.

This class defines the structure and behavior of contact records in the database. Each contact is associated with a user and contains personal information.

id¶

Primary key for the contact.

Type:

int

first_name¶

Contact’s first name, limited to 25 characters.

Type:

str

last_name¶

Contact’s last name, limited to 25 characters.

Type:

str

email¶

Contact’s email address, must be unique, limited to 100 characters.

Type:

str

phone¶

Contact’s phone number, must be unique, limited to 20 characters.

Type:

str

birthday¶

Contact’s birth date.

Type:

date

additional_info¶

Optional additional information about the contact.

Type:

str

created_at¶

Timestamp of when the contact was created.

Type:

datetime

updated_at¶

Timestamp of the last update to the contact.

Type:

datetime

user_id¶

Foreign key referencing the user who owns this contact.

Type:

int

user¶

Relationship to the User model.

Type:

User

id: Mapped[int]¶
first_name: Mapped[str]¶
last_name: Mapped[str]¶
email: Mapped[str]¶
phone: Mapped[str]¶
birthday: Mapped[date]¶
additional_info: Mapped[str]¶
created_at: Mapped[datetime]¶
updated_at: Mapped[datetime]¶
user_id: Mapped[int]¶
user¶
class User(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Base

Model representing a user in the system.

This class defines the structure and behavior of user accounts in the database. It includes authentication and profile information.

id¶

Primary key for the user.

Type:

int

username¶

Unique username for the user, limited to 100 characters.

Type:

str

email¶

Unique email address for the user, limited to 100 characters.

Type:

str

hashed_password¶

Securely hashed password for the user.

Type:

str

created_at¶

Timestamp of when the user account was created.

Type:

datetime

avatar¶

Path to the user’s avatar image file.

Type:

str

confirmed¶

Flag indicating whether the user’s email has been confirmed.

Type:

bool

id: Mapped[int]¶
username: Mapped[str]¶
email: Mapped[str]¶
hashed_password: Mapped[str]¶
created_at: Mapped[datetime]¶
avatar: Mapped[str]¶
confirmed: Mapped[bool]¶

Schema Models¶

Pydantic models for data validation and serialization.

This module defines the data models used throughout the application for: - Contact management (creation, updates, responses) - User management (registration, authentication) - Token handling - Email operations

Each model includes field validations and type checking using Pydantic.

class ContactModel(*, first_name, last_name, email, phone, birthday, additional_info)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base model for contact creation and validation.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str)

  • last_name (str)

  • email (EmailStr)

  • phone (str)

  • birthday (date)

  • additional_info (str)

first_name¶

Contact’s first name (2-50 characters)

Type:

str

last_name¶

Contact’s last name (2-50 characters)

Type:

str

email¶

Contact’s email address (validated format)

Type:

EmailStr

phone¶

Contact’s phone number (max 50 characters)

Type:

str

birthday¶

Contact’s birthday

Type:

date

additional_info¶

Additional contact information (max 250 characters)

Type:

str

first_name: str¶
last_name: str¶
email: EmailStr¶
phone: str¶
birthday: date¶
additional_info: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class ContactResponse(*, first_name, last_name, email, phone, birthday=None, additional_info=None, id, created_at, updated_at)[source]¶

Bases: ContactModel

Model for contact data responses.

Extends ContactModel to include database-specific fields and metadata. Allows for attribute-based instantiation from SQLAlchemy models.

Additional Attributes:

id (int): Unique identifier for the contact created_at (datetime): Timestamp of contact creation updated_at (datetime): Timestamp of last update

Parameters:

  • first_name (str)

  • last_name (str)

  • email (str)

  • phone (str)

  • birthday (date | None)

  • additional_info (str | None)

  • id (int)

  • created_at (datetime | None)

  • updated_at (datetime | None)

id: int¶
first_name: str¶

email: str¶
phone: str¶
birthday: date | None¶
additional_info: str | None¶
created_at: datetime | None¶
updated_at: datetime | None¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class ContactUpdate(*, first_name=None, last_name=None, email=None, phone=None, birthday=None, additional_info=None)[source]¶

Bases: ContactModel

Model for contact update operations.

All fields are optional to allow partial updates. Maintains the same validation rules as ContactModel.

Note

Fields not included in the update request will retain their current values.

Parameters:

  • first_name (Annotated[str | None, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)])

  • last_name (Annotated[str | None, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)])

  • email (EmailStr | None)

  • phone (Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=50)])

  • birthday (date | None)

  • additional_info (str | None)

first_name: str | None¶
last_name: str | None¶
email: EmailStr | None¶
phone: str | None¶
birthday: date | None¶
additional_info: str | None¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class User(*, id, username, email, avatar)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for user data responses.

Used for serializing user data in API responses. Configured to work with SQLAlchemy model attributes.

  • username (str)

  • email (str)

  • avatar (str)

class UserCreate(*, username, email, password)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for user registration requests.

Contains the minimum required fields for creating a new user. Password will be hashed before storage.

Parameters:

  • username (str)

  • email (str)

  • password (str)

username¶

Desired username for the new account

Type:

str

email¶

Email address for verification and communication

Type:

str

password¶

User’s chosen password (will be hashed)

Type:

str

username: str¶
email: str¶
password: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class Token(*, access_token, token_type)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for authentication tokens.

Used for JWT token responses after successful authentication.

Parameters:

  • access_token (str)

  • token_type (str)

access_token¶

The JWT access token

Type:

str

token_type¶

Token type (typically “bearer”)

Type:

str

access_token: str¶
token_type: str¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class RequestEmail(*, email)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for email-based requests.

Used for operations that require only an email address, such as password reset or email verification.

Parameters:

email (EmailStr)

email¶

Email address (validated format)

Type:

EmailStr

email: EmailStr¶

Services¶

Authentication Service¶

Contact Service¶

class ContactService(db)[source]¶

Bases: object

Service class for managing contact operations.

This class provides high-level business logic for contact management, including creation, retrieval, update, and deletion of contacts. It delegates database operations to ContactRepository.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession)

contact_repository¶

Repository instance for contact database operations.

Type:

ContactRepository

__init__(db)[source]¶

Initialize ContactService with database session.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async database session.

async create_contact(body, user)[source]¶

Create a new contact for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact data including name, email, phone, etc.

  • user (User) – User who owns the contact.

Returns:

Created contact instance.

Return type:

Contact

async get_contacts(skip, limit, user, q=None)[source]¶

Retrieve a paginated list of contacts with optional search.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip for pagination.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – User whose contacts to retrieve.

  • q (str | None, optional) – Search query string. Defaults to None.

Returns:

List of contacts matching the criteria.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async get_contact(contact_id, user)[source]¶

Retrieve a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – User who owns the contact.

Returns:

Contact if found and owned by user, None otherwise.

Return type:

Contact | None

async update_contact(contact_id, body, user)[source]¶

Update an existing contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Updated contact data.

  • user (User) – User who owns the contact.

Returns:

Updated contact if found and owned by user, None otherwise.

Return type:

Contact | None

async remove_contact(contact_id, user)[source]¶

Delete a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – User who owns the contact.

Returns:

Deleted contact if found and owned by user, None otherwise.

Return type:

Contact | None

async get_birthday_list(user)[source]¶

Get list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Retrieves contacts whose birthdays are within the configured notification period (typically next 7 days).

Parameters:

user (User) – User whose contacts to check.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

User Service¶

class UserService(db)[source]¶

Bases: object

Service class for handling user-related business logic.

This class provides high-level operations for user management, including user creation, retrieval, and profile updates. It uses Gravatar for default user avatars and delegates database operations to UserRepository.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession)

repository¶

Repository instance for user database operations.

Type:

UserRepository

__init__(db)[source]¶

Initialize UserService with database session.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async database session.

async create_user(body)[source]¶

Create a new user with Gravatar avatar.

Parameters:

body (UserCreate) – User creation data including email, username, and password.

Returns:

Created user instance with generated avatar.

Return type:

User

  • url (str) – New avatar URL.

Returns:

Data Access Layer¶

Database Configuration¶

Contact Repository¶

Contact repository module for database operations.

This module provides the data access layer for contact-related operations, implementing CRUD operations and specialized queries for contact management. It uses SQLAlchemy for database interactions and provides type-safe operations.

class ContactRepository(session)[source]¶

Bases: object

Repository class for contact-related database operations.

This class handles all database interactions for contacts, including: - CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) - Search functionality - Birthday notifications - User-specific contact filtering

All operations are user-scoped for data isolation.

Parameters:

session (AsyncSession)

db¶

SQLAlchemy async database session.

Type:

AsyncSession

__init__(session)[source]¶

Initialize the repository with a database session.

Parameters:

session (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session for database operations.

async get_contacts(skip, limit, user, q=None)[source]¶

Retrieve a paginated list of contacts with optional search.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of records to skip (offset).

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of records to return.

  • user (User) – User whose contacts to retrieve.

  • q (str | None, optional) – Search query for filtering contacts. Searches in first_name, last_name, and email fields.

Returns:

List of contacts matching the criteria.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async get_contact_by_id(contact_id, user)[source]¶

Retrieve a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – User who owns the contact.

Returns:

Contact if found and owned by user, None otherwise.

Return type:

Contact | None

async create_contact(body, user)[source]¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact data for creation.

  • user (User) – User who will own the contact.

Returns:

Created contact instance with all fields populated.

Return type:

Contact

async remove_contact(contact_id, user)[source]¶

Delete a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – User who owns the contact.

Returns:

Deleted contact if found and owned by user, None otherwise.

Return type:

Contact | None

async update_contact(contact_id, body, user)[source]¶

Update an existing contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Updated contact data.

  • user (User) – User who owns the contact.

Returns:

Updated contact if found and owned by user, None otherwise.

Return type:

Contact | None

async get_birthday_list(user)[source]¶

Get contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

This method finds contacts whose birthdays fall within the next week, including today. It handles month transitions correctly.

Parameters:

user (User) – User whose contacts to check.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

User Repository¶

User repository module for database operations.

This module provides the data access layer for user-related operations, implementing user management functionality including registration, authentication, email confirmation, and profile updates.

class UserRepository(session)[source]¶

Bases: object

Repository class for user-related database operations.

This class handles all database interactions for users, including: - User registration and retrieval - Email confirmation - Avatar management - User lookup by various identifiers

Parameters:

session (AsyncSession)

db¶

SQLAlchemy async database session.

Type:

AsyncSession

__init__(session)[source]¶

Initialize the repository with a database session.

Parameters:

session (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session for database operations.

async get_user_by_id(user_id)[source]¶

Retrieve a user by their ID.

Parameters:

user_id (int) – Unique identifier of the user.

Returns:

User instance if found, None otherwise.

Return type:

User | None

async get_user_by_username(username)[source]¶

Retrieve a user by their username.

Parameters:

username (str) – Unique username of the user.

Returns:

User instance if found, None otherwise.

Return type:

User | None

async get_user_by_email(email)[source]¶

Retrieve a user by their email address.

Parameters:

email (str) – Unique email address of the user.

Returns:

User instance if found, None otherwise.

Return type:

User | None

async create_user(body, avatar=None)[source]¶

Create a new user.

Creates a new user with the provided data and optional avatar. The password in the body should already be hashed.

Parameters:

  • body (UserCreate) – User creation data including username, email, and hashed password.

  • avatar (str, optional) – URL of user’s avatar image. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Created user instance with all fields populated.

Return type:

User

async confirmed_email(email)[source]¶

Mark a user’s email as confirmed.

Parameters:

email (str) – Email address of the user to confirm.

Return type:

None

Note

This method assumes the email exists in the database. It should only be called after verifying the email token.

async update_avatar_url(email, url)[source]¶

Update a user’s avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email of the user whose avatar to update.

  • url (str) – New avatar URL.

Returns:

Updated user instance.

Return type:

User

Note

This method assumes the email exists in the database. The URL should be validated before calling this method.
